name: Pickthall
text: Ta. Sin. Mim.

name: Pickthall
text: These are revelations of the Scripture that maketh plain.

name: Pickthall
text: It may be that thou tormentest thyself (O Muhammad) because they believe not.

name: Pickthall
text: If We will, We can send down on them from the sky a portent so that their necks would remain bowed before it.

name: Pickthall
text: Never cometh there unto them a fresh reminder from the Beneficent One, but they turn away from it.

name: Pickthall
text: Now they have denied (the Truth); but there will come unto them tidings of that whereat they used to scoff.

name: Pickthall
text: Have they not seen the earth, how much of every fruitful kind We make to grow therein?

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! herein is indeed a portent; yet most of them are not believers.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

name: Pickthall
text: And when thy Lord called Moses, saying: Go unto the wrongdoing folk,

name: Pickthall
text: The folk of Pharaoh. Will they not ward off (evil)?

name: Pickthall
text: He said: My Lord! Lo! I fear that they will deny me,

name: Pickthall
text: And I shall be embarrassed, and my tongue will not speak plainly, therefor send for Aaron (to help me).

name: Pickthall
text: And they have a crime against me, so I fear that they will kill me.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Nay, verily. So go ye twain with Our tokens. Lo! We shall be with you, Hearing.

name: Pickthall
text: And come together unto Pharaoh and say: Lo! we bear a message of the Lord of the Worlds,

name: Pickthall
text: (Saying): Let the Children of Israel go with us.

name: Pickthall
text: (Pharaoh) said (unto Moses): Did we not rear thee among us as a child? And thou didst dwell many years of thy life among us,

name: Pickthall
text: And thou didst that thy deed which thou didst, and thou wast one of the ingrates.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: I did it then, when I was of those who are astray.

name: Pickthall
text: Then I fled from you when I feared you, and my Lord vouchsafed me a command and appointed me (of the number) of those sent (by Him).

name: Pickthall
text: And this is the past favour wherewith thou reproachest me: that thou hast enslaved the Children of Israel.

name: Pickthall
text: Pharaoh said: And what is the Lord of the Worlds?

name: Pickthall
text: (Moses) said: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if ye had but sure belief.

name: Pickthall
text: (Pharaoh) said unto those around him: Hear ye not?

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers.

name: Pickthall
text: (Pharaoh) said: Lo! your messenger who hath been sent unto you is indeed a madman!

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Lord of the East and the West and all that is between them, if ye did but understand.

name: Pickthall
text: (Pharaoh) said: If thou choosest a god other than me, I assuredly shall place thee among the prisoners.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Even though I show thee something plain?

name: Pickthall
text: (Pharaoh) said: Produce it then, if thou art of the truthful!

name: Pickthall
text: Then he flung down his staff and it became a serpent manifest,

name: Pickthall
text: And he drew forth his hand and lo! it was white to the beholders.

name: Pickthall
text: (Pharaoh) said unto the chiefs about him: Lo! this is verily a knowing wizard,

name: Pickthall
text: Who would drive you out of your land by his magic. Now what counsel ye?

name: Pickthall
text: They said: Put him off, (him) and his brother, and send into the cities summoners

name: Pickthall
text: Who shall bring unto thee every knowing wizard.

name: Pickthall
text: So the wizards were gathered together at a set time on a day appointed.

name: Pickthall
text: And it was said unto the people: Are ye (also) gathering?

name: Pickthall
text: (They said): Aye, so that we may follow the wizards if they are the winners.

name: Pickthall
text: And when the wizards came they said unto Pharaoh: Will there surely be a reward for us if we are the winners?

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Aye, and ye will then surely be of those brought near (to me).

name: Pickthall
text: Moses said unto them: Throw what ye are going to throw!

name: Pickthall
text: Then they threw down their cords and their staves and said: By Pharaoh's might, lo! we verily are the winners.

name: Pickthall
text: Then Moses threw his staff and lo! it swallowed that which they did falsely show.

name: Pickthall
text: And the wizards were flung prostrate,

name: Pickthall
text: Crying: We believe in the Lord of the Worlds,

name: Pickthall
text: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.

name: Pickthall
text: (Pharaoh) said: Ye put your faith in him before I give you leave. Lo! he doubtless is your chief who taught you magic! But verily ye shall come to know. Verily I will cut off your hands and your feet alternately, and verily I will crucify you every one.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: It is no hurt, for lo! unto our Lord we shall return.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! we ardently hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we are the first of the believers.

name: Pickthall
text: And We inspired Moses, saying: Take away My slaves by night, for ye will be pursued.

name: Pickthall
text: Then Pharaoh sent into the cities summoners,

name: Pickthall
text: (Who said): Lo! these indeed are but a little troop,

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! they are offenders against us.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! we are a ready host.

name: Pickthall
text: Thus did We take them away from gardens and watersprings,

name: Pickthall
text: And treasures and a fair estate.

name: Pickthall
text: Thus (were those things taken from them) and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit them.

name: Pickthall
text: And they overtook them at sunrise.

name: Pickthall
text: And when the two hosts saw each other, those with Moses said: Lo! we are indeed caught.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Nay, verily! for lo! my Lord is with me. He will guide me.

name: Pickthall
text: Then We inspired Moses, saying: Smite the sea with thy staff. And it parted, and each part was as a mountain vast.

name: Pickthall
text: Then brought We near the others to that place.

name: Pickthall
text: And We saved Moses and those with him, every one;

name: Pickthall
text: And We drowned the others.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo, thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

name: Pickthall
text: Recite unto them the story of Abraham:

name: Pickthall
text: When he said unto his father and his folk: What worship ye?

name: Pickthall
text: They said: We worship idols, and are ever devoted unto them.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Do they hear you when ye cry?

name: Pickthall
text: Or do they benefit or harm you?

name: Pickthall
text: They said: Nay, but we found our fathers acting on this wise.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: See now that which ye worship,

name: Pickthall
text: Ye and your forefathers!

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! they are (all) an enemy unto me, save the Lord of the Worlds,

name: Pickthall
text: Who created me, and He doth guide me,

name: Pickthall
text: And Who feedeth me and watereth me.

name: Pickthall
text: And when I sicken, then He healeth me,

name: Pickthall
text: And Who causeth me to die, then giveth me life (again),

name: Pickthall
text: And Who, I ardently hope, will forgive me my sin on the Day of Judgment.

name: Pickthall
text: My Lord! Vouchsafe me wisdom and unite me to the righteous.

name: Pickthall
text: And give unto me a good report in later generations.

name: Pickthall
text: And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Delight,

name: Pickthall
text: And forgive my father. Lo! he is of those who err.

name: Pickthall
text: And abase me not on the day when they are raised,

name: Pickthall
text: The day when wealth and sons avail not (any man)

name: Pickthall
text: Save him who bringeth unto Allah a whole heart.

name: Pickthall
text: And the Garden will be brought nigh for those who ward off (evil).

name: Pickthall
text: And hell will appear plainly to the erring.

name: Pickthall
text: And it will be said unto them: Where is (all) that ye used to worship

name: Pickthall
text: Instead of Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?

name: Pickthall
text: Then will they be hurled therein, they and the seducers

name: Pickthall
text: And the hosts of Iblis, together.

name: Pickthall
text: And they will say, when they are quarrelling therein:

name: Pickthall
text: By Allah, of a truth we were in error manifest

name: Pickthall
text: When we made you equal with the Lord of the Worlds.

name: Pickthall
text: It was but the guilty who misled us.

name: Pickthall
text: Now we have no intercessors

name: Pickthall
text: Nor any loving friend.

name: Pickthall
text: Oh, that we had another turn (on earth), that we might be of the believers!

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers!

name: Pickthall
text: And lo, thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

name: Pickthall
text: Noah's folk denied the messengers (of Allah),

name: Pickthall
text: When their brother Noah said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

name: Pickthall
text: So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.

name: Pickthall
text: And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

name: Pickthall
text: So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: Shall we put faith in thee, when the lowest (of the people) follow thee?

name: Pickthall
text: He said: And what knowledge have I of what they may have been doing (in the past)?

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! their reckoning is my Lord's concern, if ye but knew;

name: Pickthall
text: And I am not (here) to repulse believers.

name: Pickthall
text: I am only a plain warner.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: If thou cease not, O Noah, thou wilt surely be among those stoned (to death).

name: Pickthall
text: He said: My Lord! Lo! my own folk deny me.

name: Pickthall
text: Therefor judge Thou between us, a (conclusive) judgment, and save me and those believers who are with me.

name: Pickthall
text: And We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.

name: Pickthall
text: Then afterward We drowned the others.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo, thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

name: Pickthall
text: (The tribe of) A'ad denied the messengers (of Allah).

name: Pickthall
text: When their brother Hud said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

name: Pickthall
text: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.

name: Pickthall
text: And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

name: Pickthall
text: Build ye on every high place a monument for vain delight?

name: Pickthall
text: And seek ye out strongholds, that haply ye may last for ever?

name: Pickthall
text: And if ye seize by force, seize ye as tyrants?

name: Pickthall
text: Rather keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.

name: Pickthall
text: Keep your duty toward Him Who hath aided you with (the good things) that ye know,

name: Pickthall
text: Hath aided you with cattle and sons.

name: Pickthall
text: And gardens and watersprings.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! I fear for you the retribution of an awful day.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: It is all one to us whether thou preachest or art not of those who preach;

name: Pickthall
text: This is but a fable of the men of old,

name: Pickthall
text: And we shall not be doomed.

name: Pickthall
text: And they denied him; therefor We destroyed them. Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

name: Pickthall
text: (The tribe of) Thamud denied the messengers (of Allah)

name: Pickthall
text: When their brother Salih said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

name: Pickthall
text: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.

name: Pickthall
text: And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

name: Pickthall
text: Will ye be left secure in that which is here before us,

name: Pickthall
text: In gardens and watersprings.

name: Pickthall
text: And tilled fields and heavy-sheathed palm-trees,

name: Pickthall
text: Though ye hew out dwellings in the mountain, being skilful?

name: Pickthall
text: Therefor keep your duty to Allah and obey me,

name: Pickthall
text: And obey not the command of the prodigal,

name: Pickthall
text: Who spread corruption in the earth, and reform not.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: Thou art but one of the bewitched;

name: Pickthall
text: Thou art but a mortal like us. So bring some token if thou art of the truthful.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: (Behold) this she-camel. She hath the right to drink (at the well), and ye have the right to drink, (each) on an appointed day.

name: Pickthall
text: And touch her not with ill lest there come on you the retribution of an awful day.

name: Pickthall
text: But they hamstrung her, and then were penitent.

name: Pickthall
text: So the retribution came on them. Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

name: Pickthall
text: The folk of Lot denied the messengers (of Allah),

name: Pickthall
text: When their brother Lot said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

name: Pickthall
text: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.

name: Pickthall
text: And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

name: Pickthall
text: What! Of all creatures do ye come unto the males,

name: Pickthall
text: And leave the wives your Lord created for you? Nay, but ye are froward folk.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: If thou cease not, O Lot, thou wilt soon be of the outcast.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: I am in truth of those who hate your conduct.

name: Pickthall
text: My Lord! Save me and my household from what they do.

name: Pickthall
text: So We saved him and his household, every one,

name: Pickthall
text: Save an old woman among those who stayed behind.

name: Pickthall
text: Then afterward We destroyed the others.

name: Pickthall
text: And We rained on them a rain. And dreadful is the rain of those who have been warned.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

name: Pickthall
text: The dwellers in the wood (of Midian) denied the messengers (of Allah),

name: Pickthall
text: When Shu'eyb said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

name: Pickthall
text: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.

name: Pickthall
text: And I ask of you no wage for it; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

name: Pickthall
text: Give full measure, and be not of those who give less (than the due).

name: Pickthall
text: And weigh with the true balance.

name: Pickthall
text: Wrong not mankind in their goods, and do not evil, making mischief, in the earth.

name: Pickthall
text: And keep your duty unto Him Who created you and the generations of the men of old.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: Thou art but one of the bewitched;

name: Pickthall
text: Thou art but a mortal like us, and lo! we deem thee of the liars.

name: Pickthall
text: Then make fragments of the heaven fall upon us, if thou art of the truthful.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: My Lord is Best Aware of what ye do.

name: Pickthall
text: But they denied him, so there came on them the retribution of the day of gloom. Lo! it was the retribution of an awful day.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! herein is indeed a portent; yet most of them are not believers.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! it is a revelation of the Lord of the Worlds,

name: Pickthall
text: Which the True Spirit hath brought down

name: Pickthall
text: Upon thy heart, that thou mayst be (one) of the warners,

name: Pickthall
text: In plain Arabic speech.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! it is in the Scriptures of the men of old.

name: Pickthall
text: Is it not a token for them that the doctors of the Children of Israel know it?

name: Pickthall
text: And if We had revealed it unto one of any other nation than the Arabs,

name: Pickthall
text: And he had read it unto them, they would not have believed in it.

name: Pickthall
text: Thus do We make it traverse the hearts of the guilty.

name: Pickthall
text: They will not believe in it till they behold the painful doom,

name: Pickthall
text: So that it will come upon them suddenly, when they perceive not.

name: Pickthall
text: Then they will say: Are we to be reprieved?

name: Pickthall
text: Would they (now) hasten on Our doom?

name: Pickthall
text: Hast thou then seen, if We content them for (long) years,

name: Pickthall
text: And then cometh that which they were promised,

name: Pickthall
text: (How) that wherewith they were contented naught availeth them?

name: Pickthall
text: And We destroyed no township but it had its warners

name: Pickthall
text: For reminder, for We never were oppressors.

name: Pickthall
text: The devils did not bring it down.

name: Pickthall
text: It is not meet for them, nor is it in their power,

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! verily they are banished from the hearing.

name: Pickthall
text: Therefor invoke not with Allah another god, lest thou be one of the doomed.

name: Pickthall
text: And warn thy tribe of near kindred,

name: Pickthall
text: And lower thy wing (in kindness) unto those believers who follow thee.

name: Pickthall
text: And if they (thy kinsfolk) disobey thee, say: Lo! I am innocent of what they do.

name: Pickthall
text: And put thy trust in the Mighty, the Merciful.

name: Pickthall
text: Who seeth thee when thou standest up (to pray)

name: Pickthall
text: And (seeth) thine abasement among those who fall prostrate (in worship).

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! He, only He, is the Hearer, the Knower.

name: Pickthall
text: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?

name: Pickthall
text: They descend on every sinful, false one.

name: Pickthall
text: They listen eagerly, but most of them are liars.

name: Pickthall
text: As for poets, the erring follow them.

name: Pickthall
text: Hast thou not seen how they stray in every valley,

name: Pickthall
text: And how they say that which they do not?

name: Pickthall
text: Save those who believe and do good works, and remember Allah much, and vindicate themselves after they have been wronged. Those who do wrong will come to know by what a (great) reverse they will be overturned!
